title: Graph BFS Traversal
algorithmDescription: Traverse graph level by level using BFS algorithm
detailedDescription: Implement Breadth-First Search (BFS) for a graph. Input: First line has number of vertices and edges. Next lines have edge pairs. Then starting vertex. Output: BFS traversal order starting from given vertex. Use queue to explore vertices level by level.
hints: Use queue data structure for BFS
Mark vertices as visited to avoid cycles
Enqueue starting vertex, then process neighbors level by level
Use adjacency list for graph representation
commonMistakes: Using stack instead of queue (becomes DFS)
solutionApproach: Build adjacency list from input. Use queue for BFS: enqueue start vertex, mark visited. While queue not empty: dequeue vertex, print it, enqueue all unvisited neighbors.
testCaseCriteria: Must produce correct BFS order. Should handle disconnected graphs. Must not revisit vertices.
